tools: one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice

entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Dagger|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 16 GP; or (B) 150 GP

features.name: Alchemist
entries: {@i Craft Magic Elixirs and Potions}
An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce magical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away.

features.name: Alchemist Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Alchemist Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

features.name: Experimental Elixir
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} while holding {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}, you can use that tool to magically produce two elixirs. For each elixir, roll on the Experimental Elixir table for the elixir's effect, which is triggered when someone drinks the elixir. The elixir appears in a vial, and the vial vanishes when the elixir is drunk or poured out. If any elixir remains when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the elixir and its vial vanish.

entries.name: Drinking an Elixir
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of itself.

entries.name: Creating Additional Elixirs
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while holding {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}, you can expend one spell slot to create another elixir. When you do so, you choose its effect from the Experimental Elixir table rather than rolling.
When you reach certain Artificer levels, you can make an additional elixir at the end of each {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}: a total of three at level 5, four at level 9, and five at level 15.

entries.caption: Experimental Elixir
rows: {@b Healing.} The drinker regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Intelligence modifier. The number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach Artificer levels 9 ({@dice 3d8}) and 15 ({@dice 4d8}).
{@b Swiftness.} The drinker's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet for 1 hour. This bonus increases when you reach Artificer levels 9 (15 feet) and 15 (20 feet).
{@b Resilience.} The drinker gains a +1 bonus to AC for 10 minutes. The duration increases when you reach Artificer levels 9 (1 hour) and 15 (8 hours).

{@b Boldness.} The drinker can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to every attack roll and saving throw they make for the next minute. The duration increases when you reach Artificer levels 9 (10 minutes) and 15 (1 hour).
{@b Flight.} The drinker gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 10 feet for 10 minutes. The {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} increases when you reach Artificer levels 9 (20 feet) and 15 (30 feet).
You determine the elixir's effect by choosing one of the other rows in this table.

features.name: Alchemical Savant
entries: Whenever you cast a spell using your {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} as the {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or be a damage roll that deals Acid, Fire, or Poison damage. The bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

features.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: You can cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} as the {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Alchemical Eruption
entries: When you cast an Artificer spell that deals Acid, Fire, or Poison damage to a target, you can also deal {@damage 2d8} Force damage to that target. You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.

entries.name: Chemical Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid damage and Poison damage. You also gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Conjured Cauldron
entries: You can cast {@spell Tasha's Bubbling Cauldron|XPHB} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without Material components, provided you use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} as the {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Arcane Armor
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while you have {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} in hand, you can turn a suit of armor you are wearing into Arcane Armor. The armor continues to be Arcane Armor until you don another suit of armor or you die.
You gain the following benefits while wearing your Arcane Armor.

entries.name: No Strength Requirement
entries: If the armor normally has a Strength requirement, the Arcane Armor lacks this requirement for you.

entries.name: Quick Don and Doff
entries: You can don or doff the armor as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. The armor can't be removed against your will.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use the Arcane Armor as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Artificer spells.

features.name: Armor Model
entries: You can customize your Arcane Armor. When you do so, choose one of the following armor models: {@subclassFeature Dreadnaught|Artificer|EFA|Armorer|EFA|3|EFA}, {@subclassFeature Guardian|Artificer|EFA|Armorer|EFA|3|EFA}, or {@subclassFeature Infiltrator|Artificer|EFA|Armorer|EFA|3|EFA}. The model you choose gives you special benefits while you wear it.
Each model includes a special weapon. When you attack with that weapon, you can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, to the attack and damage rolls.
You can change the armor's model whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} if you have {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} in hand.

features.name: Armorer
entries: {@i Craft Magic Armor to Enhance Your Abilities}
An Armorer modifies armor to function almost like a second skin. The armor is enhanced to hone the Armorer's magic, unleash potent attacks, and generate a formidable defense.

features.name: Armorer Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Armorer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

features.name: Dreadnaught
entries: You design your armor to become a towering juggernaut in battle. It has the following features:

items.name: Force Demolisher
entries: An arcane wrecking ball or sledgehammer projects from your armor. The demolisher counts as a Simple Melee weapon with the {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach} property, and it deals {@damage 1d10} Force damage on a hit. If you hit a creature that is at least one size smaller than you with the demolisher, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from yourself or pull the creature up to 10 feet toward yourself.

items.name: Giant Stature
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you transform and enlarge your armor for 1 minute. For the duration, your reach increases by 5 feet, and if you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn't enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn't change. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Guardian
entries: You design your armor to be in the front line of conflict. It has the following features:

entries.name: Thunder Pulse
entries: You can discharge concussive blasts with strikes from your armor. The pulse counts as a Simple Melee weapon and deals {@damage 1d8} Thunder damage on a hit. A creature hit by the pulse has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Defensive Field
entries: While {@status Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Artificer level. You lose these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} if you doff the armor.

features.name: Infiltrator
entries: You customize your armor for subtler undertakings. It has the following features:

items.name: Lightning Launcher
entries: A gemlike node appears on your armor, from which you can shoot bolts of lightning. The launcher counts as a Simple Ranged weapon with a normal range of 90 feet and a long range of 300 feet, and it deals {@damage 1d6} Lightning damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with the launcher, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Lightning damage to that target.

items.name: Powered Steps
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet.

items.name: Dampening Field
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks. If the armor imposes {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on such checks, the {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} cancel each other, as normal.

features.name: Improved Armorer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Replication
entries: You learn an additional plan for your Replicate Magic Item feature, and it must be in the Armor category. If you replace that plan, you must replace it with another Armor plan.
In addition, you can create an additional item with that feature, and the item must also be in the Armor category.

entries.name: Improved Arsenal
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the special weapon of your Arcane Armor model.

features.name: Perfected Armor
entries: Your Arcane Armor gains additional benefits based on its model, as detailed below.

entries.name: Dreadnaught
entries: The damage die of your Force Demolisher increases to {@damage 2d6} Force damage.

In addition, when you use your Giant Stature, your reach increases by 10 feet, your size can increase to Large or Huge (your choice), and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength saving throws for the duration.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: The damage die of your Thunder Pulse increases to {@damage 1d10} Thunder damage.

In addition, when a Huge or smaller creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to magically force that creature to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you pull the creature up to 25 feet directly toward you to an unoccupied space. If you pull the target to a space within 5 feet of yourself, you can make a melee weapon attack against it as part of this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

You can take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Infiltrator
entries: The damage die of your Lightning Launcher increases to {@damage 2d6} Lightning damage. Any creature that takes Lightning damage from your Lightning Launcher glimmers with magical light until the start of your next turn. The glimmering creature sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 5-foot radius, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against you, as the light jolts it if it attacks you.

Additionally, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to twice your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} until the end of the current turn. You can take this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Artillerist
entries: {@i Wield Destructive Power from Afar}
An Artillerist specializes in using magic to hurl energy, projectiles, and explosions on a battlefield.

features.name: Artillerist Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Artillerist Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Artillerist Spells
rows: {@spell Cone of Cold|XPHB}, {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}

features.name: Eldritch Cannon
entries: Using {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Woodcarver's Tools|XPHB}, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to create a Small or Tiny {@object Eldritch Cannon|EFA} in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of yourself. You determine its appearance, including whether you carry it or not (and your choice of legs or wheels, for the latter). It disappears if it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or after 1 hour. You can dismiss it early as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.

Once you create a cannon, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or expend a spell slot to create one. You can have only one cannon at a time and can't create one while you already have one.

features.name: Arcane Firearm
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use {@item Woodcarver's Tools|XPHB} to carve special sigils into a {@item Rod|XPHB}, {@item Staff|XPHB}, {@item Wand|XPHB}, or {@filter Martial Ranged weapon|items|type=martial weapon;ranged weapon=sand} and thereby turn it into your Arcane Firearm. The sigils disappear from the object if you later carve them on a different item. The sigils otherwise last indefinitely.

You can use your Arcane Firearm as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Artificer spells. When you cast an Artificer spell through the firearm, roll {@damage 1d8}, and you gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to the number rolled.

features.name: Explosive Cannon
entries: Every {@object Eldritch Cannon|EFA} you create is now more destructive. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Detonate
entries: When your cannon takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command the cannon to detonate if you are within 60 feet of it. Doing so destroys the cannon and forces each creature within 20 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 3d10} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Firepower
entries: The cannon's damage rolls and the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by Protector increase by {@dice 1d8}.

features.name: Fortified Position
entries: You're a master at forming well-defended emplacements using your {@object Eldritch Cannon|EFA}. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Double Firepower
entries: You can now have two cannons at the same time, and you can create two with the same {@action Magic|XPHB} action. (If you expend a spell slot to create the first cannon, you must expend another spell slot to create the second.) You can activate both of them with the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, ordering them to use the same activation option or different ones. You can't create a third cannon while you have two.

entries.name: Shimmering Field Projection
entries: You and your allies have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} while within 10 feet of your {@object Eldritch Cannon|EFA}.

features.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn. You can forgo one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to command your {@creature Steel Defender|EFA} to take the Force-Empowered Rend action.

features.name: Battle Ready
entries: Your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways.

entries.name: Arcane Empowerment
entries: When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Weapon Knowledge
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter Martial weapons|items|type=martial weapon}. You can use a weapon with which you have proficiency as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Artificer spells.

features.name: Battle Smith
entries: {@i Command a Construct Guardian}

A Battle Smith is a combination of protector and medic, an expert at defending others and repairing both materiel and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths are accompanied by a {@creature Steel Defender|EFA}, a protective companion of their own creation.

features.name: Battle Smith Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Battle Smith Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

features.name: Steel Defender
entries: Your tinkering has borne you a companion, a {@creature Steel Defender|EFA}. You determine the defender's appearance and whether it has two legs or four; your choices don't affect the defender's game statistics.
The {@creature Steel Defender|EFA|defender} is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies and obeys you. It vanishes if you die.

entries.name: The Defender in Combat
entries: In combat, the defender acts during your turn. It can move and take its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command it to take an action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the defender acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Restoring or Replacing the Defender
entries: If the defender has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch it and expend a spell slot. The defender returns to life after 1 minute with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can create a new {@creature Steel Defender|EFA|defender} if you have {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} in hand. If you already have a defender from this feature, the first one vanishes.

features.name: Arcane Jolt
entries: When either you hit a target with an attack roll using a magic weapon or your {@creature Steel Defender|EFA} hits a target, you can channel magical energy through the strike to create one of the following effects:

items.name: Destructive Energy
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Force damage.

items.name: Restorative Energy
entries: Choose one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of the target. Healing energy flows into the chosen recipient, restoring {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to it.

You can use this energy a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), but you can do so no more than once per turn. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Improved Defender
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Arcane Jolt|Artificer|EFA|Battle Smith|EFA|9|EFA} and {@creature Steel Defender|EFA} have become more powerful, granting these benefits.

entries.name: Improved Jolt
entries: The extra damage and healing of your Arcane Jolt both increase to {@dice 4d6}.

entries.name: Improved Deflection
entries: Whenever your {@creature Steel Defender|EFA} uses its Deflect Attack, the attacker takes Force damage equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your Intelligence modifier.

features.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} and {@item Cartographer's Tools|XPHB}. If you already have one of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice (or with two other types if you have both).

entries.name: Scroll Crafting
entries: When you scribe a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} using the crafting rules in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

features.name: Adventurer's Atlas
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} while holding {@item Cartographer's Tools|XPHB}, you can use that tool to create a set of magical maps by touching at least two creatures (one of whom can be yourself), up to a maximum number of creatures equal to 1 plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of two creatures). Each target receives a magical map, which constantly updates to show the relative position of all the map holders but is illegible to all others. The maps last until you die or until you use this feature again, at which point any existing maps created by this feature immediately vanish.
While carrying the map, a target gains the following benefits.

entries.name: Awareness
entries: The target adds {@dice 1d4} to its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

entries.name: Positioning
entries: The target knows the location of all other map holders that are on the same plane of existence as itself. When casting a spell or creating another effect that requires being able to see the effect's target, a map holder can target another map holder regardless of sight or cover, so long as the other map holder is still within the effect's range.

features.name: Cartographer
entries: {@i Chart Advantageous Courses through Turmoil}
Cartographers are the premier navigators and reconnaissance agents. Using their creations, Cartographers can highlight threats, safeguard allies, and carve portals to distant locations.

features.name: Cartographer Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Cartographer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Cartographer Spells
rows: {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB}, {@spell Guiding Bolt|XPHB}, {@spell Healing Word|XPHB}

features.name: Mapping Magic
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Illuminated Cartography
entries: You can cast {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB} without expending a spell slot, outlining the affected creatures as if in ink. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Portal Jump
entries: On your turn, you can spend an amount of movement equal to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} (round down) to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of yourself or within 5 feet of a creature that is within 30 feet of you and holding one of your Adventurer's Atlas maps. You can't use this benefit if your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0.

features.name: Guided Precision
entries: Once per turn, whenever you cast a spell from your Cartographer Spells list or hit a creature affected by your {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB} with an attack roll, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of the spell or attack.
In addition, taking damage can't cause you to lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB}.

features.name: Ingenious Movement
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Flash of Genius|Artificer|EFA|7|EFA}, you or a willing creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of yourself can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see as part of that same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

features.name: Superior Atlas
entries: Your Adventurer's Atlas improves, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Safe Haven
entries: When a map holder would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, that creature can destroy its map. The creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} instead change to a number equal to twice your Artificer level, and the creature is teleported to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you or another map holder of its choice.

entries.name: Unerring Path
entries: If you are one of the map holders for your Adventurer's Atlas, you can cast {@spell Find the Path|XPHB} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without needing spell components. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
